definition: central building (in a traditional house)/primary wife
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)

sentences.english: Many of these workers lived in the main house, but some lived in the nearby town.
sentences.chinese: 這些工人許多住在正房，但一些住在附近的城鎮。

sentences.english: Lidazhao lived in the main room, north on the east wing after his marriage.
sentences.chinese: 李大釗結婚後就住在東廂房北面的正房。

definition: central room of a traditional Chinese house
reception pavilion (generally part of a large residence, and often built in a garden)
warm room/warm partition of a room
second branch of an extended family/concubine
remote relatives (with the same family name)
